byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jamal al-Badrani and Kamil Kakol from Erbil, Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad, and Michael R. Gordon from northern Iraq.

abstract: Iraqi Prime Min Haider al-Abadi announces campaign by nation's forces, including airstrikes, to reclaim embattled city of Mosul, where as many as 4,500 Islamic State forces are brutally ruling residents; Mosul offensive is being aided by American air support and additional 615 American troops, bringing total of American forces in Iraq to more than 5,000.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi on Monday announced the launch of a campaign to retake Mosul. In the days before, residents were hoarding food and Islamic State militants were frantically building tunnels.
snippet: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi on Monday announced the launch of a campaign to retake Mosul. In the days before, residents were hoarding food and Islamic State militants were frantically building tunnels....

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Attack Mosul, a Beleaguered Stronghold for ISIS
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Forces Attack Mosul, a Beleaguered Stronghold for ISIS
